case_title: GHULAM RASOOL, And Other vs THE STATE

accussed_details.name: Ghulam Rasool
allegation: Non-cultivation of leased land to 90% extent

complaint_summary: Petitioners failed to pay rent and cultivate leased land to the required extent under the 15 years Leases Scheme.
investigation_summary: The AC/Collector Lodhran resumed the disputed land on 25.3.1981 due to breaches. Appeals to the Additional Commissioner on 30.6.1992 and Member (J-III) on 30.3.1995 and 15.5.1995 were dismissed as time-barred.
judgment_summary: The court condoned the breaches with a penalty of Rs.5,000/- each, restored the lease, and extended it until Rabi 1998. Petitioners were directed to deposit arrears and penalty within three months to apply for proprietary rights under the 1995 scheme.
punishment: Penalty of Rs.5,000/- each imposed on petitioners.
Decision_or_verdict: Review petitions accepted; lower court orders modified.

petitioner_claims: Lower courts did not consult the record
court_findings: Non-cultivation and non-payment of rent are rectifiable breaches.

assets: Disputed land under 15 years Leases Scheme
key_issues: Non-cultivation of leased land to 90% extent

legal_terms.lagan: Rent or revenue paid by tenants to the government.

words_and_phrases.rectifiable breaches: Breaches that can be corrected or remedied.

summary_vector_notes: Review petitions filed against time-barred dismissal of appeals regarding non-payment of rent and non-cultivation of leased land. Court condoned breaches with penalties and restored lease until Rabi 1998.
